channel.title: CVE Feed for Lenovo -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Lenovo -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-2992|2024-07-23T18:19:01.571Z -- lenovo -- system%20management%20module%20%28smm%29
item.description: An unauthenticated denial of service vulnerability exists in the SMM v1, SMM v2, and FPC management web server which can be triggered under crafted conditions. Rebooting SMM or FPC will restore access to the management web server.

item.title: CVE-2023-4855|2024-07-09T20:00:42.214Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A command injection vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user with elevated privileges to execute unauthorized commands via IPMI.

item.title: CVE-2023-4857|2024-07-09T19:59:02.276Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute certain IPMI calls that could lead to exposure of limited system information.

item.title: CVE-2023-4856|2024-07-09T17:42:49.691Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A format string vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute arbitrary commands on a specific API endpoint.

item.title: CVE-2024-27911|2024-06-20T15:59:08.416Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain the administrator password.

item.title: CVE-2024-27912|2024-06-20T15:57:13.662Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an attacker to cause the device to crash by sending crafted LPD packets.

item.title: CVE-2024-27909|2024-06-20T15:47:17.193Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in the HTTPS service of some Lenovo Printers that could result in a system reboot.

item.title: CVE-2024-4696|2024-06-13T20:01:18.145Z -- lenovo -- service%20bridge
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Service Bridge prior to version 5.0.2.17 that could allow operating system commands to be executed if a specially crafted link is visited.

item.title: CVE-2024-2659|2024-04-15T18:00:12.275Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A command injection vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user with elevated privileges to execute system commands when performing a specific administrative function.

item.title: CVE-2024-3286|2024-05-16T17:21:21.869Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A buffer overflow vulnerability was identified in some Lenovo printers that could allow an unauthenticated user to trigger a device restart by sending a specially crafted web request.

item.title: CVE-2024-23591|2024-02-20T21:47:49.570Z -- lenovo -- thinksystem%20sr670%20v2
item.description:
ThinkSystem SR670V2 servers manufactured from approximately June 2021 to July 2023 were left in Manufacturing Mode which could allow
an attacker with privileged logical access to the host or physical access to server internals to modify or disable Intel Boot Guard firmware integrity, SPS security, and other SPS configuration setting. The server’s NIST SP 800-193-compliant Platform Firmware Resiliency (PFR) security subsystem significantly mitigates this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-23593|2024-06-04T17:45:57.103Z -- lenovo -- windows%207%20and%208%20pc%20preloads
item.description:
A vulnerability was reported
in a system recovery bootloader that was part of the Lenovo preloaded Windows 7 and 8 operating systems from 2012 to 2014
that could allow a privileged attacker with local access to modify the boot manager and escalate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-23592|2024-04-05T20:46:20.996Z -- lenovo -- synaptics%20fingerprint%20readers
item.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability was reported in Lenovo devices with Synaptics fingerprint readers that could allow an attacker with physical access to replay fingerprints and bypass Windows Hello authentication.

item.title: CVE-2024-23594|2024-04-15T18:01:23.230Z -- lenovo -- windows%207%20and%208%20pc%20preloads
item.description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported
in a system recovery bootloader that was part of the Lenovo preloaded Windows 7 and 8 operating systems from 2012 to 2014
that could allow a privileged attacker with local access to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2024-27911|2024-04-05T20:47:01.657Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain the administrator password.

item.title: CVE-2024-27910|2024-04-05T20:46:55.352Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to reboot the printer without authentication.

item.title: CVE-2024-27909|2024-04-05T20:46:46.021Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in the HTTPS service of some Lenovo Printers that could result in a system reboot.

item.title: CVE-2024-27908|2024-06-04T17:47:05.996Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported in the HTTPS service of some Lenovo Printers that could result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-27912|2024-04-05T20:47:09.905Z -- lenovo -- printers
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Printers that could allow an attacker to cause the device to crash by sending crafted LPD packets.

item.title: CVE-2023-25494|2024-04-05T20:46:09.016Z -- lenovo -- desktop%20bios%2C%20smart%20edge%20bios%2C%20thinkstation%20bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability were reported in the BIOS of some Desktop, Smart Edge, and ThinkStation products that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to write to NVRAM variables.

item.title: CVE-2023-25493|2024-04-05T20:46:00.491Z -- lenovo -- bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability was reported in the BIOS update tool driver for some Desktop, Smart Edge, Smart Office, and ThinkStation products that could allow a local user with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2023-4855|2024-06-04T17:27:12.561Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A command injection vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user with elevated privileges to execute unauthorized commands via IPMI.

item.title: CVE-2023-4605|2024-04-05T20:44:43.105Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20administrator
item.description: A valid authenticated Lenovo XClarity Administrator (LXCA) user can potentially leverage an unauthenticated API endpoint to retrieve system event information.

item.title: CVE-2023-4857|2024-04-15T18:00:03.660Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute certain IPMI calls that could lead to exposure of limited system information.

item.title: CVE-2023-4856|2024-06-04T17:27:25.529Z -- lenovo -- smm%2C%20smm2%2C%20fpc
item.description: A format string vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user to execute arbitrary commands on a specific API endpoint.

item.title: CVE-2023-5912|2024-06-06T18:47:37.560Z -- lenovo -- notebook%20bios
item.description: A potential memory leakage vulnerability was reported in some Lenovo Notebook products that may allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to write to NVRAM variables.

item.title: CVE-2024-4696|2024-06-14T15:40:41.315Z -- lenovo -- service%20bridge
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was reported in Lenovo Service Bridge prior to version 5.0.2.17 that could allow operating system commands to be executed if a specially crafted link is visited.

item.title: CVE-2023-25494|2024-06-20T16:17:26.297Z -- lenovo -- desktop%20bios%2C%20smart%20edge%20bios%2C%20thinkstation%20bios
item.description: A potential vulnerability were reported in the BIOS of some Desktop, Smart Edge, and ThinkStation products that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to write to NVRAM variables.

item.description: A command injection vulnerability was identified in SMM/SMM2 and FPC that could allow an authenticated user with elevated privileges to execute system commands when performing a specific administrative function.
